intro: Beloperone albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin beloperone, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white-petaled flowers with distinct yellow margins. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Beloperone albomarginata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
